quizzes.question: The File class belongs to which namespace?
quizzes.textContent:
[h1]Writing to Files[/h1]

The [b]System.IO[/b] namespace has various classes that are used for performing numerous operations with files, such as creating and deleting files, reading from or writing to a file, closing a file, and more.
The [b]File [/b]class is one of them. For example: [code format="cs" ]string str = "Some text";
[b]File.WriteAllText("test.txt", str);[/b][/code]
The [b]WriteAllText()[/b] method creates a file with the specified path and writes the content to it. If the file already exists, it is overwritten. 
The code above creates a file [b]test.txt[/b] and writes the contents of the [b]str[/b] string into it.
[note]To use the [b]File [/b]class you need to use the System.IO namespace: [b]using System.IO;[/b][/note]

[h1]Reading from Files[/h1]

You can read the content of a file using the ReadAllText method of the File class: [code format="cs" codeId="915"]string txt = File.[b]ReadAllText[/b]("test.txt");
Console.WriteLine(txt); [/code]
This will output the content of the test.txt file.
The following methods are available in the File class:
[b]AppendAllText()[/b] - appends text to the end of the file.
[b]Create() [/b]- creates a file in the specified location.
[b]Delete() [/b]- deletes the specified file.
[b]Exists()[/b] - determines whether the specified file exists.
[b]Copy()[/b] - copies a file to a new location.
[b]Move()[/b] - moves a specified file to a new location
[note]All methods automatically close the file after performing the operation.[/note]
